{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3155005,"name":"John Medeiros","username":"DATBOI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/b4bc9f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-01T02:53:53.674Z","cooked":"

Okay, so I am trying to write a program for our FRC team. Currently I am using a Mecanum drive, and a timed robot code format. I have recently installed the ADXRS450 Gyroscope to the robot in order to get the data input necessary to be able to do field oriented drive, but I am struggling to incorporate it into my program, and from what I have seen, resources on the subject have been few and far between, and unhelpful. Anyone who could teach me how to do this would have my gratitude.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-01T02:53:53.674Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":466,"readers_count":465,"score":143.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428517,"topic_slug":"im-dumb-and-need-help-from-those-who-arent","display_username":"John Medeiros","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52060,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/im-dumb-and-need-help-from-those-who-arent/428517/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3155025,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-01T03:19:57.247Z","cooked":"

What have you tried? Have any code we could look at? Have you seen this documentation?

I’m apologizing in advance because I don’t have much in the way of helping you with your problem(link some code, videos, etc!), but you’re not dumb, absolutely not. Don’t disparage yourself!

Yes, I have looked at the documentation, and it was only helpful up to a point; I understand how to import the device into the program, but I don’t know how to call the telemetry into the program, or format it in a way that makes it drivable.

Okay so you have the gyro in your program and are getting good readings from it?

You mentioned field oriented drive, do you already have a swerve drive controllable robot oriented? Did you make your own swerve code or use a library? I will assume you made your own because most libraries already have this built in. Do you understand ChassisSpeeds? If you have robot relative drive already working it is likely you just need to use .fromFieldRelativeSpeeds

You can see how many assumptions I had to make above. Can we see your code? It is hard to give advice when we can’t see where you are at.

Okay, so as I have said, I am using a Mecanum drive system, holonomic drive, or whatever you want to call it. I have gotten as far as the import of the gyroscope, and not much further. I am not sure how to use the methods of the gyro, or what the methods even are. I think I understand conceptually how I need to implement it, I just don’t know the syntax

This is an example of mecanum with an analog gyro, the m_gyro.getRotation2d() that is found on line 54 of Robot.java should be similar to what you are looking for: allwpilib/Robot.java at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

If you haven’t perused the example projects from WPILib, they are often extremely helpful to me: WPILib Example Projects — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
